Title: Seoul confirms first MERS infection case
Description: South Korea's Health Ministry on Wednesday confirmed its first Middle East Respiratory Syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) case in a patient who returned from Bahrain to Seoul earlier this month. The 68-year-old is currently reported to be in a stable condition.

Title: China Confirms First Case of MERS, a South Korean Man
Description: China on Friday confirmed its first case of Middle East Respiratory Syndrome in a South Korean businessman who ignored instructions to stay home after his father was diagnosed with the disease.

Title: More Than 680 in South Korea Isolated Over MERS Virus Fears
Description: More than 680 people in South Korea are isolated after having contact with patients infected with a virus that has killed hundreds of people in the Middle East.

Title: Two People Die of MERS in South Korea
Description: South Korea confirmed the country's first two deaths from Middle East Respiratory Syndrome as it fights to contain the spread of the virus that has killed hundreds of people in the Middle East.South Korea's cases have connections to the first patient, either medical staff who treated him or patients who stayed near the man at the hospital before he was diagnosed and isolated.

Title: Camels in Seoul Grand Park isolated
Description: As fears of Middle East Respiratory Syndrome infection spreads, camels at a local zoo have been isolated. Camels are thought to be major reservoirs for MERS. The World Health Organization has advised people to avoid close contact with animals, particularly camels, when visiting farms or other open areas where the virus is known to be circulating.

Title: Korean Official on MERS School Closings
Description: The South Korean education minister, Hwang Yoo-Wea, announced class cancellations and precautionary measures after the virus killed two.

Title: Tourists in South Korea on MERS Scare
Description: Tourists in South Korea on Thursday described their feelings about the outbreak of Middle East Respiratory Syndrome in the country.

Title: Citizens take initiative in MERS fight
Description: With the government restricting access to information on the recent Middle East respiratory syndrome outbreak _ two weeks after the country's first patient was diagnosed _ the public is taking matters into its own hands to stay informed.

Title: Mayor's MERS remarks cause stir
Description: Seoul Mayor Park Won-soon late Thursday night held a press conference to blast the government's failure to share information on the MERS outbreak, a move praised by many frustrated with lax government measures, but also stroking criticism for allegedly spreading unverified information.

Title: Top hospital new source of MERS outbreak
Description: Samsung Medical Center, one of South Korea's top hospitals, was identified as a source of infection of the Middle East respiratory syndrome as health authorities revealed that 17 patients contracted the deadly virus while staying at the facility.

Title: First teen MERS patient confirmed
Description: Seoul confirmed five more MERS-affected hospitals, one death and 23 more cases Monday, bringing the nation's total number of cases to 87 and the death toll to six. Among the newly confirmed patients was a 16-year-old, the first Korean teenager to be diagnosed.

Title: W.H.O. to Look Into MERS in South Korea
Description: Keiji Fukuda, the World Health Organization's assistant director general for health security, spoke on Tuesday with experts in the country to investigate the recent outbreak of MERS.

Title: Taiwan Widens Its Travel Alert to All South Korea, Not Only Seoul
Description: The alert issued by Taiwan's Centers for Disease Control also recommended that Taiwanese avoid medical institutions when traveling in South Korea.

Title: First pregnant woman confirmed of MERS
Description: South Korea confirmed the first case of Middle East respiratory syndrome of a pregnant woman. The woman in her 40s appeared to have been infected with the virus while briefly staying at an emergency room at the Samsung Medical Center, where the 14th confirmed patient was staying. The woman is due to give birth this month and was staying at the hospital's maternity ward.

Title: Cathay Pacific Bookings to Korea Down on Disease Fear: CEO
Description: Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd has seen a drop in bookings from Hong Kong to cities in South Korea, where cases of Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) have recently increased, Chief Executive Ivan Chu said Tuesday.

Title: MERS infections exceed 100 in Korea
Description: Thirteen more cases and two more deaths of Middle East respiratory syndrome were confirmed Wednesday, bringing the total number of infected to 108 and the death toll to nine, as South Koreans hung on to hopes that the virus would start abating this week.

Title: Report Says 2 South Koreans Lied About MERS to Skip Work
Description: South Korea's Yonhap News Agency reported Friday that police charged a 20-year-old saleswoman at a department store for spreading a rumor online that it was hiding an outbreak of MERS among staff. Her boyfriend was charged for helping her post the rumor on Facebook via another user.

Title: South Korea Steps Up MERS Fight
Description: Workers sprayed disinfectant in a South Korean market as new cases of Middle East respiratory syndrome continue to be identified.

Title: MERS Cases in South Korea Rise to 150 With Five More, One Death
Description: South Korea's health ministry reported five new cases of Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS), taking the total to 150 in an outbreak that is the largest outside Saudi Arabia. The ministry also said a patient infected with the MERS virus had died, the 16th fatality in an outbreak that began in May.

Title: Three More Die in South Korea's MERS Outbreak, Death Toll at 23
Description: South Korea's health ministry reported  three more deaths in the country's Middle East Respiratory Syndrome outbreak, bringing the total number of fatalities to 23. The ministry also confirmed three new cases, taking the total to 165 in the outbreak that is the largest outside Saudi Arabia.

Title: Samsung Heir Apologizes for MERS Spread at Samsung Hospital
Description: Lee Jae-yong, 47, apologized to MERS victims and patients in his first public speech since taking over the Samsung Foundation last month. He succeeded his ailing father in leading the charity foundation that owns Samsung Medical Center. Out of 175 MERS patients in South Korea, 85 were patients, relatives, staff or visitors at the Samsung hospital in Seoul.

Title: Park's office snubs calls to apologize over MERS
Description: The presidential office said Wednesday that it would focus first on combating the Middle East respiratory syndrome, brushing aside the mounting calls from political circles to apologize over the government's poor initial handling of the disease. 'For now, we have to prioritize coping with the MERS outbreak and bringing an end to it,' said a senior presidential official.

Title: After MERS, South Korea Authorizes Prison for Quarantine Scofflaws
Description: The new law requires the health authorities to make public certain information about an outbreak of infectious disease, including the names and locations of infected hospitals and the routes taken by exposed patients. The government was criticized for waiting weeks to reveal the names of the hospitals where MERS infections had been reported.
